tripreview.Title: "Delicious Iced Tea!"
tripreview.sentence: If it's really hot and you are dying for refreshment, go here for their iced tea.
you mix it yourself and it's YUM.

tripreview.Title: "A good place to chill out."
tripreview.sentence: If you are getting a bit worn down by India, this is a cosmopolitan little venue in a shady environment, serving good, healthy food.
The art is interesting.

tripreview.Title: "Creative art space to work"
tripreview.sentence: Wrote all my travel articles here in a cool, chilled, good vibes good music kind of place.
You must try out their ayurvedic dish - organic brown rice set!

tripreview.Title: "Arty"
tripreview.sentence: Very calming place.

tripreview.Title: "Big meals lucky to finish"
tripreview.sentence: I recommend the omlette, but beware it is huge and comes with lots of bread, I had it for bruch no need for lunch.
service is very quick too!

tripreview.Title: "Woth being"
tripreview.sentence: One of the best things to do in Kochi.
Try chocolate homemade cake, you will not regret.
The prices are also good.

tripreview.Title: "A touch of class with Art"
tripreview.sentence: fort Kochi is the art capital of INdia and they do it well.
Kashi has style so makes sure that it has art displays in a clean environment that is interesting and classy.

tripreview.Title: "Great breakfast"
tripreview.sentence: Lovely relaxing place, with shady areas and a mix of customers.
The art work didn't impress but the breakfast omelettes were excellent
served with thick toast and melon on the side.
Other reviewers loved the coffee, but it was not to our taste.
We all have different tastes, and unlike another reviewer, we thought the music was great.
It's a great busy little place with interesting shops nearby

tripreview.Title: "Excellent gallery and desserts"
tripreview.sentence: Came here very late in the night.
Almost closing time, but, place is a must see in Kochi.
Very thought provoking art gallery.
This is complemented with plenty of options to help your sweet tooth.

tripreview.Title: "Great place to chill out"
tripreview.sentence: A small art gallery at the front, with a great courtyard cafe to the rear.
Served good food and drink with a nice atmosphere.
Mainly tourists in here.

tripreview.Title: "Beautiful coffee. Beautiful atmosphere !"
tripreview.sentence: Great atmosphere.
Beautifully decorated.
Lovely gallery as well with contemporary art.
Coffee was fabulous !

tripreview.Title: "Wonderful courtyard space and some interesting art on display"
tripreview.sentence: Sat and had an iced coffee in the courtyard with a friend.
Nice and shady seating area surrounded by art and potted, trailing plants.
The space has been thoughtfully designed in a modern style and has a relaxed yet bustling atmosphere of locals and travellers alike.

tripreview.Title: "" the Bst place ""
tripreview.sentence: The best place to hang out with frnds n family.
Loved the place.
Realy yummy food.
Sandwiches, chocolate cake, cold coffee AND Today the best orange cake and the banana pie I hv evr had just loved it yummy.

tripreview.Title: "Laidback , ambient and calm art cafe in Fort Kochi"
tripreview.sentence: One of the best hangout spots in fort kochi, and nested among the dutch architecture and ecletic mix of native folks and expats, this cafe is the go to spot for any person visiting here.
The simple home made chocolate cake and chocolate milk is to die for.
Hit it up for a memorable bang on buck art plus cafe experience!

tripreview.Title: "Great Place to Escape the Heat"
tripreview.sentence: This little cafe provided refuge from the famous Kerala heat.
The Indian food in Kerala is delicious, but I highly recommend this spot for non-Indian options.
The changing art gallery is a must see.

tripreview.Title: "great sunday breakfast option"
tripreview.sentence: our weekly fixture for a great ambience and variety of food.
the peaceful and ambient climate is just the right mix to be at on a sunday morning.

tripreview.Title: "Best coffee in kochi"
tripreview.sentence: The ambience is the best among cafes in Kochi.
And so is their addictive hot coffee.
The service was brisk.
The press coffee was the best we had in kochi.

tripreview.Title: "Delicious food"
tripreview.sentence: A great cafe with delicious food, a lovely atmosphere and Good music.
A great place to meet friends or to just chill with a book and a juice.

tripreview.Title: "an evening with friends"
tripreview.sentence: love to visit this place whenever we are in fort kochi.
nice ambience,food but the service is not that excellent.
a bit more pleasant service would be appreciated.

tripreview.Title: "Must Visit"
tripreview.sentence: Wonderful place to relax and eat delicious eateries.
It is very near to the beach and market.
Highly recommended.

tripreview.Title: "State of the art buzzing coffee shop"
tripreview.sentence: This place is a Kochi institution, so we had to pop by for lunch one day.
The atmosphere was good, it was quite busy, mostly tourists.
Due to the busy time of day, our service was unfortunately lacking, with menu's taking a while to arrive and a long delay before we were able to order.
This was compounded with the fact that when it arrived, my chickpea salad was near inedible, doused with what appeared to be half a shaker worth of black pepper.
I was quite disappointed, as the menu itself sounded quite nice, and a great alternative to all the curries we had been eating.
I would return next visit, though definitely order something else!

tripreview.Title: "an evening with friends"
tripreview.sentence: love to visit this place whenever we are in fort kochi.
nice ambience,food but the service is not that excellent.
a bit more pleasant service would be appreciated.

tripreview.Title: "Must Visit"
tripreview.sentence: Wonderful place to relax and eat delicious eateries.
It is very near to the beach and market.
Highly recommended.

tripreview.Title: "State of the art buzzing coffee shop"
"Must Visit"
tripreview.sentence: Wonderful place to relax and eat delicious eateries.
It is very near to the beach and market.

tripreview.Title: "Unique modern art venue"
tripreview.sentence: Traveling around India, we found a lot of typical tourist shops and cafes.
Few try to bridge the gap between traditional India and modern world art as much as Kashi.
Beyond the good food, the art can change between typical paintings to nude sketches.
Very avant-garde and really worth the trip to see the daily/monthly art exhibition.
The actual venue is quite big with 3 separate seating areas behind the initial art gallery room.
If the kitchen is making it, suggest you try the Chocolate Cake.
Sponge cake is good, but the chocolate coulis placed on top is to die for!
And the kitchen does not skimp on the slice size - many patrons left their pieces only 2/3 eaten, but all raving about it.

tripreview.Title: "A must visit in fort kochi!!!"
tripreview.sentence: A art gallery and cafe with healthy and delicious dishes!
It was a wonderful place to have great food with view of arts !

tripreview.Title: "must visit"
tripreview.sentence: good food and good hosts.
try the cakes and today's specials.
nice art gallery on the entrance.

tripreview.Title: "Choc C.a.k.e"
tripreview.sentence: The ambience !
The smell of freshly baked chocolate cakes, chocolate sauce and the freedom to make your own cold coffee !

tripreview.Title: "Must see cafe and gallery in Fort Kochi"
tripreview.sentence: We had heard a lot about Kashi Art Cafe so had to check it out.
it was quite full on a late Sat afternoon but we got a corner stool seat luckily, and got a more comfortable table soon, which we shared with a couple from England.

The service was rather slow, as the waiters were catching up with the heavy inflow of tourists, but we waited patiently, and like what we had- a Pesto Fussili Pasta, and a couple of drinks- ginger lemonade and Spinach Cucumber Juice.
The pasta was fresh and I liked that they had not overdone the pesto with cheese(as they do in many places).
We enjoyed a buzz at the place some more time and admired the interiors and lively ambiance before leaving for another cafe trail down in Fort Kochi.

tripreview.Title: "Great place for a healthey Quick Breakfast"
tripreview.sentence: It is by far the most beautiful place I have visited in Fort Kochi.
Amazingly tasty breakfast with a wonderful atmosphere, makes me give this place a 5/5 :) Their Spinach mushroom cheese omelets are a must have.

tripreview.Title: "Quaint and charming place"
tripreview.sentence: A favourite hangout for both locals and foreigners.
This place has an awesome dutch and arty ambience and you feel like sitting here for hours on end.

tripreview.Title: "Nice western style cafe"
tripreview.sentence: But please don't go for the art.
as there is very little of it to see.
Hence the three star rating as I really like art!
It is a nice bright clean western style cafe with lots of light and plants.
A nice place to relax and a an oasis of calm in the chaos of Fort Cochin.
Western style menu makes a nice change from spicy South Indian food - however delicious - sometimes you need a change!
Clean loo.

tripreview.Title: "Lively venue with a great atmosphere"
tripreview.sentence: The Kashi Gallery and Cafe is a great place to relax and enjoy lunch and wouldn't be out of place in the trendy areas of London.
We visited several times during our trip to Fort Kochi for a break from Keralan cuisine and to soak up the atmosphere.
It seems to be very popular with tourists and travellers for the WiFi and simple meals.
We were lucky to get a table each time we visited but don't let that put you off - have a look around the gallery until a table frees up!
Food portions are generous and we enjoyed the salads and sandwiches, as well as a reasonable amount of cake envy when we were too full to order dessert!
Drinks can take a while but it didn't bother us - we were on holiday!

tripreview.Title: "Very slow service and food safety not as advertised"
tripreview.sentence: Table next to us found a maggot in their food.
We waited and waited to order, and then waited and waited for our drinks -- and we ordered iced tea and lemonade!
Drinks didn't get come at the same time.
Then we waited and waited for the bill only to realize you have to go up front to pay.
Really quite poor service.
The only draw for us was that they use safe water to make ice, a novelty in India
but not really worth it.

tripreview.Title: "Great spot for a coffee, and a quick bite to eat!"
tripreview.sentence: Stopped in several times for an espresso and a quick lunch or dinner.
Great atmosphere and friendly people.

tripreview.Title: "Great place and with lovely food"
tripreview.sentence: If you want a break from eating south India food, this place offers delicious sandwiches, omelettes and cakes.
It is very busy so service can sometimes be a bit slow but it is well worth the wait.
Great energy and light in here with free wifi and a clean toilet and lovely art to look at on the way in and out.

tripreview.Title: "A wonderful Cafe"
tripreview.sentence: Yes, they have art, but this is the best coffee shop/cafe in town, perhaps in all of southern India.
When you have had enough of crowded India, this is the place to spend a few quiet moments.

tripreview.Title: "More than a gallery"
tripreview.sentence: I found this gem on the last day of my stay in Kochi and I wish I had found the place sooner.
It was, without a doubt, one of my favorite finds in the city.
This eclectic and bohemian little shop has great service, and phenomenal atmosphere.
I had never expected to find such a place in southern India, and it would be just as successful were they to have placed it in New York, London, or Paris.
This is a must see for anyone craving a decent coffee and the refuge of a creative safe-haven.

tripreview.Title: "Good food , Ambience"
tripreview.sentence: A great place to spend the evening with family after a visit to the Fort Kochi beach .
The snacks were great and the ambiance was good.

tripreview.Title: "Went there for Desserts"
tripreview.sentence: We had a heavy lunch in one of the seafood joints and dropped into Kashi for a quick dessert.
There were only 2 options so we decided to go in for the Choc cake which was pretty good.
They can improve by having a few more options.

tripreview.Title: "Well worth visiting "
tripreview.sentence: Really nice place.
OK, so service is slow, but the atmosphere is nice and the food is fine.
Great stop off.

tripreview.Title: "Good food, little art"
tripreview.sentence: We headed here for morning coffee and to look at the modern art works.
The coffee and drinks were good although the range of cakes was poor.
There were not a lot of art works although the few we saw were interesting.

tripreview.Title: "Great food, lovely staff, fab setting, slow service!"
tripreview.sentence: Such a lovely setting for breakfast, lunch or dinner at Kashi Art Cafe.
The food tastes great, but the service is very slow.
Really nice, helpful and friendly staff though!
Just make sure you've got some time.

tripreview.Title: "Serene, excellent quality, fast favourite :)"
tripreview.sentence: It's a little oasis of calm with great quality food and some really interesting pieces of art extending into the cafe itself.
We had sandwiches and wraps for lunch and so impressed we came back the next day (fresh, tasty ingredients).
Really appreciate their drive to save on plastic by serving drinkable water in glass bottles.

tripreview.Title: "Amazing"
tripreview.sentence: Absolutely fantastic.
Food was delcious.
Excellent range if refreshing drinks all made with safe drinking waste.
Beautiful setting and great staff.
Couldn't ask for more.

tripreview.Title: "Beautiful place to have a meal"
tripreview.sentence: This was a little oasis in Fort Kochi.
I had a lovely breakfast of cinnamon cake with fruit.
The amount of fruit they served was awesome!
Way more than I expected, and everything was the perfect ripeness.
I would have loved to eaten here more, if I was spending more time in Fort Kochi.

tripreview.Title: "Cafe with great atmosphere"
tripreview.sentence: Cafe has really cool surroundings and atmosphere, definitely go for a cup of coffee.
Serves really good ice coffee, it's a nice touch they give milk and syrup separately so you can flavour to taste.
Food choice is good sandwiches, salads, light lunches etc.

tripreview.Title: ""One Great Cafe""
tripreview.sentence: For the sake of Art n Good Food this is the place you have to be in.
No words just simple and Awesome menu but you get all you need to fill your Tummy.
The waiters are up to the mark with pleasant character.
The Penne was great so was the Granola.
You will surely fell in LOVE with this space on your very first visit and that's something for sure.

tripreview.Title: "Awesome coffee shop to hang around "
tripreview.sentence: Kashi is like the heart of coffee shops in Fort Cochin.
It's an awesome place to hang out, gives you the privacy and can spend time with your loved ones.
The theme is like awesome in kashi.

tripreview.Title: "Disappointing Evening"
tripreview.sentence: Stumbled across Kashi by accident one afternoon.
Had the most amazing omelette and coffee fresh and reasonably priced.

Great atmosphere and service however, return at the end of our holiday early evening, we both chose the lasagne which although delicious was clearly reheated in a microwave as my daughters arrive at least ten minutes before mine and the portions were tiny.

Having spoken to a lady sat next to us she told us she had tried to order after us but they had sold out so clearly ours was the last and they has stretched it out into two portions it was however delicious.

The staff during early evening were two young lads who were actually quite rude, when my daughter and I sat down they were clearly saying something about me and then started to laugh i ignored it as you do!
The service in general in the evening was poor compared to the day time however it wouldn't stop me going again

tripreview.Title: "Not as good as it used to be"
tripreview.sentence: I used to frequent Kashi's before the whole renovation was done and I used to love it those days.
Now the place has been renovated but I feel its lacking in the feel good ambiance that used to be there before.
The service is just lacking soul.
The food is still good though.

tripreview.Title: " "Brilliant Art Works with addicting Coffees ""
tripreview.sentence: We went here for more than a couple of times that we love the ambience and coffee as well.
This cafe provides u with addicted press coffees and varieties in tea.
They provide some kind of Farmer's Sandwich with fruits which make us definitely to come back without doubt.
Apart from this the art work make us to stay some extra time to simply sit and stare
Coffee lovers please don't miss this since you will regret for sure.
My kid enjoyed the Hot chocolate cake which we will order whenever we come.
Have some chit and chat and u will love the calm ambience for sure

tripreview.Title: "Great ambience and yummy food"
tripreview.sentence: Overall a dining pleasure.
Love the food each time I go there, haven't been disappointed yet.
Pleasant staff.
There's always an interesting display of art up.

tripreview.Title: "Great food in a modern surrounding "
tripreview.sentence: We have eaten here a few times, having pasta and chicken sandwiches,all very good.
The 'cold coffee' was extremely good.

tripreview.Title: "Great food and drink at an incredibly reasonable price."
tripreview.sentence: The ambiance is simple, but the art work catches your attention.
The service and the food were terrific.
An easy walk from the Sajhome Stay.

tripreview.Title: "Food, check. Ambience, check. Experience, check."
tripreview.sentence: It's a cozy and very artistic.
Loved the food there.
The way your food and drink is served is just too cute.
They are mostly packed, and the service a little slow.
You need to have some patience.
Go with a mind to sit back, relax, soak in the ambience and enjoy yourself to a lovely treat!

tripreview.Title: "More style than substance"
tripreview.sentence: (This place is categorized as a gallery, but what I am reviewing is the restaurant) We had heard a lot about this place from online reviews as well as from friends.
Personally, I thought it was more style than substance.
The food was not bad, but it was more artsy with more focus on the setting and the decor than on the menu options.
The food itself was tasty, well-presented and good value for money, but the overall options itself were quite limited.
You can certainly eat here if you are in the vicinity, but I wouldn't drive out again to Fort Kochi specifically to eat here as we did this time.

tripreview.Title: "Good"
tripreview.sentence: A nice and quiet place to hangout and talk over a coffee with your friends or that special one.

tripreview.Title: "Good ambience and food!"
tripreview.sentence: Located right at the centre of fortkochi, Kashi art cafe is always thronged by foreign tourists as it has a unique ambience and a menu that seperates it from other cafes around.
Must try items on the menu- Cold coffee, chocolate cake and spinach cheese omelette !

tripreview.Title: "Comforting cafe with yum baked stuff and good coffee"
tripreview.sentence: I've been to Fort Kochi thrice and I absolutely love Kashi Art Cafe.
I go there for the comfortable, unpretentious ambience and good food.
Early mornings are beautiful.
As you wait for breakfast, fresh loaves of bread are brought down and the whole place has a warm and fuzzy aroma of fresh baking.
The portions are generous and the service good.
Nice place to unwind.

tripreview.Title: "Amazing Food, Amazing Service, Amazing Place"
tripreview.sentence: The food is delicious, we tried a variety of dishes in the three or four times we went and every time it was great and the drinks were very good too.
The place has a very nice feel and is well kept.
Our server each time was Nadhin, he was the friendliest, warmest guy always with a genuine smile on his face, we really really wanted to take him back to England with us as he was so nice.

tripreview.Title: "Cool and has real coffee!!!"
tripreview.sentence: For a country, and a part of the country that grows it, the Indian idea of coffee doesn't marry well with my own.
But finally here (as only in Pondicherry or high end hotels) here is real (or very close to it) coffee and I thanked them for it by taking three!
Often hard to get a seat here and people linger, its very pleasant here so you would.
The front room is used as a gallery but I would add more seats too.
The service can be leisurely so it all fits well.
There are western meals like quiche and so on here.
Not sure what I thought about the omelette I ate.
I would always avoid westernised food in this country.
In a culture so filled with astonishingly brilliant food I don't understand the need.
But this is such a good spot.
Calm and cool in the hot Kerala daytime.
In the cool streets of the old city and surrounded on the way in by creative street art and truly lovely interior art by genuine Kerallan artists.

I don't know if its a permanent feature but when there I saw a brilliant sculpture of Kerallan heads - brilliantly modelled, captured all of the features seen all around in this multi cultural part of the sub-continent.
In case you have to wait for a table, take your own newspapers.

tripreview.Title: "This a fabulous Art Cafe."
tripreview.sentence: It is not only a gallery but also a cafe and serves the best european food across Kochi.
The ambience is great as well.
The portions they serve is quite sumptuous.

tripreview.Title: "In love with this place"
tripreview.sentence: Perfect blend of classy art gallery and hip cafe.
It's modernist, verdant, and extremely relaxing.
Went there for a ginger lemonade and soup of the day my first evening in Kochi which was awesome.
Excellent for breakfast and lunch, doing a bit of work, and/or just chilling out.

tripreview.Title: "For Art lovers"
tripreview.sentence: Its a nice little place to spend couple of hours.
especially for art lovers.
Sandwiches and cakes are good.

tripreview.Title: "Great Food- MUST VISIT"
tripreview.sentence: This is a small place not to be missed for great food, excellent service and cozy setup.
We went there twice and ordered the vegetarian lasagna and chicken salad sandwich.
It was really yum.

tripreview.Title: "Classy place but not overly expensive"
tripreview.sentence: Lovely courtyard setting and really good coffee and lunch.
Just off the main drag of Princess St so away from the noise and the staff are attentive.
Also, good loo!

tripreview.Title: "Nice cafe!"
tripreview.sentence: Behind the Princess Street, tucked away in a narrow lane is the Kashi art gallery and cafe.
The restaurant is lively, great service and healthy food.
Overall a nice experience!

tripreview.Title: "Plus food"
tripreview.sentence: What a lovely contemporary gallery in the next street over from Princess Street.
The added bonus is the Kashi restaurant.
